intro: Glycosmis sinensis, commonly known as the Chinese date or wild date tree, is a small evergreen shrub or tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically red or orange when mature, containing a single seed. Glycosmis sinensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in traditional medicine and ornamental horticulture.
